    public class LoginActivity
extends FreeturiloActivity
    An activity displaying the login form for administrators of the system.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:
    FreeturiloActivity, AuthCredentials

        private final API api

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate​(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when this activity is created.

        Calls FreeturiloActivity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle). Initializes the layout of this activity.

        Overrides:
        onCreate in class FreeturiloActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - unused parameter, included for compatibility with AppCompatActivity
        See Also:
        Places, StorageConnector

      • validate

        private boolean validate()
        Validates input data of the login form.

        Checks if the email input contains an email address and if the password input is not empty. If one of this conditions is false, a validation error occurs.

        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether validation has passed

      • login

        public void login​(@NonNull
                  android.view.View view)
        Authenticates the user. Called when the login button is clicked.

        Validates input data of the login form. If validation passes, the authentication request is sent to api.

        Parameters:
        view - unused parameter, the login button
        See Also:
        API.postUserAsync(com.example.freeturilo.misc.AuthCredentials, com.example.freeturilo.misc.Callback<java.lang.String>, com.example.freeturilo.connection.APIHandler)

      • goToAdmin

        private void goToAdmin​(@NonNull
                       java.lang.String token)
        Starts the AdminActivity. Called after a successful authentication.

        Sets the authorization token for global application usage. Finishes this activity.

        Parameters:
        token - an authorization token returned from api
        See Also:
        Activity.finish(int), AuthTools.setToken(java.lang.String)
